Name: Dr Gillian Leng
Job Title: Deputy Chief Exec & Evidence and Practice Director
Job/Team Function: The Deputy Chief Executive and Evidence and Practice Director, is responsible for leading the management of NICE in the absence of the Chief Executive, and has overall responsibility for the Evidence and Practice Directorate. This directorate provides a range of services including NHS Evidence, the National Prescribing Centre and implementation support for NICE guidance.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job/Team Function: The NICE International Director is responsible for providing advice to governments and other organisations outside the UK on strengthening their healthcare decision-making processes and methods. All NICE International activities are funded by client countries or international aid agencies.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job/Team Function: The Implementation Programme Director is responsible for providing support key audiences and organisations, within and beyond the NHS, to maximise uptake of all types of evidence-based advice issued by NICE. The Programme works with national agencies to develop a supportive environment for implementation, provides practical support (e.g. costing and commissioning tools, audit and e-learning, local field visits), and evaluates the uptake and impact of guidance and implementation support activities.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job/Team Function: The Evidence Resources Programme Director is responsible for the development and management of the specialist resources which are accessed through the NHS Evidence service.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Professor Carole Longson
Job Title: Centre for Health Technology Evaluation Director
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Health Technology Evaluation Director is responsible for leading the development of national guidance to the NHS on the use of new and existing medicines, treatments, medical technologies, diagnostics and procedures.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Ms. Jane Gizbert
Job/Team Function: The Communications Director is responsible for ensuring that all those with an interest in the work of NICE understand its role and responsibilities and for contributing to the core work of producing guidance through the editing, distribution and promotion processes. The Communications Director is responsible for media relations; external communications, including NICE website, events and exhibitions, public affairs and stakeholder relations; enquiry handling; internal communications; and editorial and publishing.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Professor Michael Kelly
Job Title: Centre for Public Health Excellence Director
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Public Health Excellence Director is responsible for leading the development of guidance on public health topics for those working in the NHS, local authorities and the wider public, private and voluntary sectors.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job/Team Function: The Engagement and Management Programme Director is responsible for ensuring that people are aware of the NHS Evidence service through external communications work, and that user needs are evaluated and inform the development of the service. The Engagement and Management Programme Director is also responsible for contract management and procurement for the NHS Evidence Service.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Mr. Ben Bennett
Job/Team Function: The Business Planning and Resources Director is responsible for finance, business planning,human resources, estates, corporate governance and IT services for NICE.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job Title: Devices and Diagnostic Systems Programme Director
Job/Team Function: The Devices and Diagnostic Systems Programme Director is responsible for leading the development of guidance on the use of new or existing medical technologies, interventional procedures and diagnostics in the NHS.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Dr Fergus Macbeth
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Clinical Practice Director is responsible for leading the development of guidelines and quality standards on a wide range of clinical topics aimed primarily at those working in the NHS, local authorities but also of relevance to the wider public, private and voluntary sectors.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job Title: Centre for Clinical Practice Programme Director
Job/Team Function: The Centre for Clinical Practice Programme Director is responsible for leading the operational development of clinical guidance, quality standards and QOF indicators on a wide range of clinical topics.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job/Team Function: The Technology Appraisals Programme Director and the Patient Access Schemes Liaison Unit is responsible for leading the development of guidance on the use of new and existing medicines and treatments in the NHS, and for providing advice on the feasibility of implementing patient access schemes.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Job/Team Function: The Chief Information Officer is responsible for leading on the development and maintenance of the NHS Evidence service and for the development of new online products which increase the accessibility of NICE guidance, such as NICE Pathways.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Professor Peter Littlejohns
Job/Team Function: The Clinical and Public Health Director is responsible for a research and development programme to improve the methods that NICE uses to develop guidance, and to encourage partners to commission research relevant to the work of NICE.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence

Name: Sir Andrew Dillon
Job/Team Function: The Chief Executive is responsible for the strategic leadership of NICE. NICE is an independent organisation responsible for providing national guidance on promoting good health and preventing and treating ill health.
Organisation: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence
